title: Ashley HomeStore Inflated Pricing Settlement
description: No proof of purchase required, but must provide store address and purchase date
value: $750K total settlement. Claims regarding deceptive discount pricing.
notes: California residents who purchased products from an Ashley HomeStore between March 9, 2017, and March 27, 2022, where the "original price" or "regular price" was at least 10% greater than the "invoice price". Cash payment (varies) plus $35 store voucher

title: Legacy Health Patient Privacy Settlement 2025 - $15 for Meta/Google Data Sharing
amount: $15 cash + 1 year privacy monitoring ($1M identity theft insurance)
description: Legacy Health patients in Oregon and Washington may qualify for a $15 cash payment if you used your patient portal between 2019-2024. The class action settlement alleges Legacy Health shared your protected health information with Meta (Facebook) and Google using tracking pixels without consent, violating patient privacy rights. File your claim by March 16, 2026 to receive compensation plus free Medical Shield Complete privacy monitoring (1 year, $1M identity theft insurance).

title: City of Chicago v DoorDash, Inc., Caviar LLC
description: DoorDash settled with the City of Chicago over allegations that it listed Chicago restaurants on its platform without their consent or contractual agreements, violating a city ordinance requiring written agreements with restaurants. The settlement benefits small Chicago-based restaurants (nine or fewer locations) that were listed on DoorDash or Caviar between August 2019 and November 2025 without a contract. Eligible restaurants can receive up to $2,500 each by submitting an attestation form by the March 30, 2026 deadline.

title: City of Chicago v DoorDash, Inc., Caviar LLC
description: DoorDash settled with the City of Chicago over allegations that it listed Chicago restaurants on its platform without their consent or contractual agreements, violating a city ordinance requiring written agreements with restaurants. The settlement benefits small Chicago-based restaurants (nine or fewer locations) that were listed on DoorDash or Caviar between August 2019 and November 2025 without a contract. Eligible restaurants can receive up to $2,500 each by submitting an attestation form by the March 30, 2026 deadline.

title: Gryphon Healthcare Data Breach Settlement 2024 - Cash Payment for Exposed Medical Records
description: Were your medical records exposed in the July 2024 Gryphon Healthcare data breach? If your Social Security number, health insurance information, or personal health data was compromised in this Texas class action settlement, you may qualify for a cash payment. The cyberattack affected patients whose information was stored by Gryphon Healthcare, a medical billing services provider. Submit your claim by April 16, 2026 to receive compensation for the data security incident.

title: Cencora/The Lash Group Data Security Incident Settlement
description: Data breach involving personal information including names, SSNs, health/insurance info, and financial data. Settlement offers documented loss payments up to $5,000 or cash fund payment without documentation.

title: Martin Lynch v. Multnomah County Tax Foreclosure Surplus Proceeds Settlement
description: Class action about surplus proceeds from tax-foreclosed property sales in Multnomah County, Oregon. Eligible property owners (or heirs/successors) can file a claim to recover surplus proceeds from sales between October 12, 2017 and June 25, 2025.

title: CAVU eCommerce AirportParking Mandatory Service Charge Settlement
description: Class action settlement alleging CAVU did not properly disclose a mandatory service charge on Airportparkingreservations.com and/or Airportparking.com bookings. California residents who booked between July 1, 2024 and March 10, 2025 and paid the charge may submit a claim for a pro rata payment based on the total fees paid.

title: Collins, et al. v. Anthem, Inc. Residential Treatment Criteria Settlement
description: Settlement for people whose Anthem denied coverage for residential treatment of a mental health condition or substance use disorder between April 29, 2017 and April 30, 2025. Class members receive a nominal payment automatically, and those who paid out-of-pocket can file a claim for partial reimbursement with proof of payment.

title: Joybird / La-Z-Boy Deceptive Discounts Settlement
description: Settlement over alleged deceptive discount advertising on Joybird products. California consumers who purchased on Joybird.com or at a Joybird store at a sale price between Dec. 18, 2019 and Oct. 31, 2025 can claim a $115 cash payment (or receive store credit if no claim is filed).

title: Joybird / La-Z-Boy Deceptive Discounts Settlement
description: Settlement over alleged deceptive discount advertising on Joybird products. Oregon consumers who purchased on Joybird.com or at a Joybird store at a sale price between Dec. 18, 2019 and Oct. 31, 2025 can claim a $115 cash payment (or receive store credit if no claim is filed).

title: Joybird / La-Z-Boy Deceptive Discounts Settlement
description: Settlement over alleged deceptive discount advertising on Joybird products. Washington consumers who purchased on Joybird.com or at a Joybird store at a sale price between Dec. 18, 2019 and Oct. 31, 2025 can claim a $115 cash payment (or receive store credit if no claim is filed).

title: DuPont PFAS Contamination Settlement - Hoosick Falls / Town of Hoosick
description: Settlement for people tied to PFAS (PFOA) contamination in Hoosick Falls/Town of Hoosick, New York. Eligible claimants must submit a claim form by the deadline to receive payment or benefits, with eligibility based on strict criteria.

title: Peck v. Progressive Stacked UM/UIM Coverage Settlement
description: Settlement for New Mexico Progressive policyholders who paid for stacked UM/UIM coverage on a single-vehicle policy during the covered period. Eligible class members may receive automatic payments or submit a claim/payment election by the deadline.

title: Hyundai/Kia Multistate Immobilizer Settlement
description: Multistate settlement providing financial compensation for qualifying thefts or theft attempts involving certain Hyundai and Kia vehicles without factory immobilizers. Eligible customers may claim up to $4,500 for total loss, up to $2,250 for partial loss, or up to $375 for qualifying theft attempt expenses, and can also receive a free zinc sleeve installation at dealerships.

title: YouTube Privacy Settlement - Children’s Privacy Claims
description: Settlement for alleged collection of children’s data on YouTube; eligible U.S. viewers who were under 13 during the covered period can submit a claim for a pro rata cash payment (parent/guardian submits for minors).

title: Oklahoma Earthquakes Lawsuits 2024 Class Action Settlements
description: Settlements for alleged earthquake damage tied to wastewater disposal wells; eligible Oklahoma property owners (2019 through the effective date) must file a claim and provide proof of ownership and damage documentation.

title: Patterson v. OptumRx TCPA Calls Settlement
description: TCPA settlement about certain prerecorded “clinical adherence” calls to cell/VOIP numbers; approved claims are estimated at $72-$135 depending on how many people file (online claim may require a Class Member ID).

title: Backpage Remission Program - Trafficking Victim Compensation
description: DOJ remission program to compensate eligible people trafficked through Backpage and/or CityXGuide; petition requires documentation of monetary and/or behavioral health losses.

title: Nelnet Data Breach Class Action Settlement
description: Settlement for individuals whose personal information was compromised in Nelnet's August 2022 data breach. Covers student loan borrowers. Compensation for out-of-pocket losses, lost time, plus 2 years free credit monitoring ($374 value).

title: Nationwide Pet Insurance Robocalls Class Action Settlement
description: Settlement for consumers who received robocalls from Nationwide about pet insurance renewal/expiration after January 6, 2021. No proof required. Estimated $17.50 per person.

title: Kaiser Permanente Text Message Class Action Settlement
description: Settlement for consumers who received marketing texts from Kaiser after opting out (replied STOP) between Jan 2021-Aug 2025. Nationwide class + special Florida class. No proof required.

title: Sutter Health Privacy Class Action Settlement
description: California residents who logged into Sutter Health MyHealthOnline portal June 2015-March 2020. Settlement over third-party tracking technologies. No proof required.

title: RIBridges Data Breach Class Action Settlement
description: Rhode Island residents who received data breach notice from state about RIBridges system breach in 2024. Deloitte settlement. Includes credit monitoring.

title: Google Play Store Class Action Settlement
description: Settlement for consumers who made purchases through Google Play Store or paid for in-app content between Aug 2016-Sept 2023. NO CLAIM FORM REQUIRED - automatic payment!

title: ZOA Energy "0 Preservatives" Class Action Settlement
description: Settlement for consumers who purchased ZOA Energy drinks labeled "0 Preservatives" between March 2021-Nov 2025. $1 per unit up to $10 without proof or $150 with proof.

title: Wells Fargo Subscription Billing Class Action Settlement
description: Settlement for consumers enrolled in recurring billing by Tarr, Triangle, or Apex entities since 2009. Involves free trial scams for personal care, e-cigarettes, supplements. $20 flat without proof, proportional share with documentation.

title: Sealy 1250 Thread Count Class Action Settlement
amount: $40 without proof, full refund with proof
description: Settlement for consumers who purchased Sealy bedding products (sheets, pillowcases) with 1250 thread count between Oct 2016-Oct 2025. $5 per product, max $40 without proof (8 products), unlimited with proof.

title: Papaya Gaming Solitaire Cash Bot Players Settlement
description: Settlement for users who had Papaya accounts and made deposits in Solitaire Cash, Bubble Cash, Bingo Cash, 21 Cash, or Triple Match Cash from Jan 2019-Sept 2024. Claims games used bots and misled players about skill-based gameplay.

title: OptumRx Unsolicited Robocalls Settlement
description: Settlement for non-customers who received clinical adherence robocalls from OptumRx using artificial or prerecorded voice since April 2020. Does not include prescription refill reminders or COVID vaccine calls.
